metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3598 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in OpenEXR's ImfDeepScanLineInputFile functionality in versions prior to 3.0.5. An attacker who is able to submit a crafted file to an application linked with OpenEXR could cause an out-of-bounds read. The greatest risk from this flaw is to application availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3598` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr25 - 2.5.7-1
openexr - 2.5.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.7-1').
